properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone to which the access rule should be added.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Friendly name of the Access Application.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: (Required) The complete URL of the asset you wish to put Cloudflare Access in front of. Can include subdomains or paths. Or both.

properties.name: session_duration
properties.description: (Optional) How often a user will be forced to re-authorise. Must be one of 30m, 6h, 12h, 24h, 168h, 730h.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: application_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the application the policy is associated with.

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone to which the access rule should be added.

properties.name: decision
properties.description: (Required) Defines the action Access will take if the policy matches the user. Allowed values: allow, deny, bypass

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Friendly name of the Access Application.

properties.name: precedence
properties.description: (Optional) The unique precedence for policies on a single application. Integer.

properties.name: require
properties.description: (Optional) A series of access conditions, see below for full list.

properties.name: exclude
properties.description: (Optional) A series of access conditions, see below for full list.

properties.name: include
properties.description: (Required) A series of access conditions, see below for full list.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description: » Conditions
require, exclude and include arguments share the available conditions which can be applied. The conditions are:

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Optional) A list of IP addresses or ranges. Example: ip = ["1.2.3.4", "10.0.0.0/2"]

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Optional) A list of email addresses. Example: email = ["test@example.com"]

properties.name: email_domain
properties.description: (Optional) A list of email domains. Example: email_domain = ["example.com"]

properties.name: everyone
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating permitting access for all requests. Example: everyone = true
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Optional) The DNS zone to which the access rule should be added.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Required) The action to apply to a matched request. Allowed values: "block", "challenge", "whitelist", "js_challenge"

properties.name: notes
properties.description: (Optional) A personal note about the rule. Typically used as a reminder or explanation for the rule.

properties.name: configuration
properties.description: (Required) Rule configuration to apply to a matched request. It's a complex value. See description below.
Note: If both zone and zone_id are empty, then access rule will be set to the account level and apply to all their zones.
The configuration block supports:

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required) The request property to target. Allowed values: "ip", "ip_range", "asn", "country"

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The value to target. Depends on target's type.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: account_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the account where the Access Service is being created.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Friendly name of the token's intent.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: email_address
properties.description: (Required) The email address of the user who you wish to manage. Note: Following creation, this field becomes read only via the API and cannot be updated.

properties.name: role_ids
properties.description: (Required) Array of account role IDs that you want to assign to a member.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID that you wish to manage Argo on.

properties.name: tiered_caching
properties.description: (Optional) Whether tiered caching is enabled. Valid values: on or off. Defaults to off.

properties.name: smart_routing
properties.description: (Optional) Whether smart routing is enabled. Valid values: on or off. Defaults to off.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Optional) The zone ID where the custom pages should be updated. Either zone_id or account_id must be provided.

properties.name: account_id
properties.description: (Optional) The account ID where the custom pages should be updated. Either account_id or zone_id must be provided. If account_id is present, it will override the zone setting.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of custom page you wish to update. Must be one of basic_challenge, waf_challenge, waf_block, ratelimit_block, country_challenge, ip_block, under_attack, 500_errors, 1000_errors, always_online.

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) URL of where the custom page source is located.

properties.name: state
properties.description: (Required) Managed state of the custom page. Must be one of default, customised. If the value is default it will be removed from the Terraform state management.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone id to the custom ssl cert should be added.

properties.name: custom_ssl_options
properties.description: (Required) The certificate, private key and associated optional parameters, such as bundle_method, geo_restrictions, and type.
custom_ssl_options block supports:

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: (Required) Certificate certificate and the intermediate(s)

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: (Required) Certificate's private key

properties.name: bundle_method
properties.description: (Optional) Method of building intermediate certificate chain. A ubiquitous bundle has the highest probability of being verified everywhere, even by clients using outdated or unusual trust stores. An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it. Valid values are ubiquitous (default), optimal, force.

properties.name: geo_restrictions
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the region where your private key can be held locally. Valid values are us, eu, highest_security.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to enable support for legacy clients which do not include SNI in the TLS handshake. Valid values are legacy_custom (default), sni_custom.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone to which the Filter should be added.

properties.name: paused
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this filter is currently paused. Boolean value.

properties.name: expression
properties.description: (Required) The filter expression to be used.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A note that you can use to describe the purpose of the filter.

properties.name: ref
properties.description: (Optional) Short reference tag to quickly select related rules.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone to which the Filter should be added.

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Required) The action to apply to a matched request. Allowed values: "block", "challenge", "allow", "js_challenge". Enterprise plan also allows "log".

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) The priority of the rule to allow control of processing order. A lower number indicates high priority. If not provided, any rules with a priority will be sequenced before those without.

properties.name: paused
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this filter based firewall rule is currently paused. Boolean value.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description of the rule to help identify it.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The zone ID to add the load balancer to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The DNS name (FQDN, including the zone) to associate with the load balancer.

properties.name: fallback_pool_id
properties.description: (Required) The pool ID to use when all other pools are detected as unhealthy.

properties.name: default_pool_ids
properties.description: (Required) A list of pool IDs ordered by their failover priority. Used whenever region/pop pools are not defined.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Free text description.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) Time to live (TTL) of this load balancer's DNS name. Conflicts with proxied

properties.name: steering_policy
properties.description: (Optional) Determine which method the load balancer uses to determine the fastest route to your origin. Valid values are: "off", "geo", "dynamic_latency", "random" or "". Default is "".

properties.name: proxied
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the hostname gets Cloudflare's origin protection. Defaults to false.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Enable or disable the load balancer. Defaults to true (enabled).

properties.name: region_pools
properties.description: (Optional) A set containing mappings of region/country codes to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the given region. Fields documented below.

properties.name: pop_pools
properties.description: (Optional) A set containing mappings of Cloudflare Point-of-Presence (PoP) identifiers to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the PoP (datacenter). This feature is only available to enterprise customers. Fields documented below.

properties.name: session_affinity
properties.description: (Optional) Associates all requests coming from an end-user with a single origin. Cloudflare will set a cookie on the initial response to the client, such that consequent requests with the cookie in the request will go to the same origin, so long as it is available.
region_pools requires the following:

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) A region code which must be in the list defined here. Multiple entries should not be specified with the same region.

properties.name: pool_ids
properties.description: (Required) A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use in the given region.
pop_pools requires the following:

properties.name: pop
properties.description: (Required) A 3-letter code for the Point-of-Presence. Allowed values can be found in the list of datacenters on the status page. Multiple entries should not be specified with the same PoP.

properties.name: pool_ids
properties.description: (Required) A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use for traffic reaching the given PoP.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: expected_body
properties.description: (Optional) A case-insensitive sub-string to look for in the response body. If this string is not found, the origin will be marked as unhealthy. Only valid and required if type is "http" or "https".

properties.name: expected_codes
properties.description: (Optional) The expected HTTP response code or code range of the health check. Eg 2xx. Only valid and required if type is "http" or "https".

properties.name: method
properties.description: (Optional) The method to use for the health check. Valid values are any valid HTTP verb if type is "http" or "https", or connection_established if type is "tcp". Default: "GET" if type is "http" or "https", or "connection_established" if type is "tcp" .

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) The timeout (in seconds) before marking the health check as failed. Default: 5.

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Optional) The endpoint path to health check against. Default: "/". Only valid if type is "http" or "https".

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional) The interval between each health check. Shorter intervals may improve failover time, but will increase load on the origins as we check from multiple locations. Default: 60.

properties.name: retries
properties.description: (Optional) The number of retries to attempt in case of a timeout before marking the origin as unhealthy. Retries are attempted immediately. Default: 2.

properties.name: header
properties.description: (Optional) The HTTP request headers to send in the health check. It is recommended you set a Host header by default. The User-Agent header cannot be overridden. Fields documented below. Only valid if type is "http" or "https".

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) The protocol to use for the healthcheck. Currently supported protocols are 'HTTP', 'HTTPS' and 'TCP'. Default: "http".

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Free text description.

properties.name: allow_insecure
properties.description: (Optional) Do not validate the certificate when monitor use HTTPS. Only valid if type is "http" or "https".

properties.name: follow_redirects
properties.description: (Optional) Follow redirects if returned by the origin. Only valid if type is "http" or "https".
header requires the following:

properties.name: header
properties.description: (Required) The header name.

properties.name: values
properties.description: (Required) A list of string values for the header.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A short name (tag) for the pool. Only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

properties.name: origins
properties.description: (Required) The list of origins within this pool. Traffic directed at this pool is balanced across all currently healthy origins, provided the pool itself is healthy. It's a complex value. See description below.

properties.name: check_regions
properties.description: (Optional) A list of regions (specified by region code) from which to run health checks. Empty means every Cloudflare data center (the default), but requires an Enterprise plan. Region codes can be found here.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Free text description.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to enable (the default) this pool. Disabled pools will not receive traffic and are excluded from health checks. Disabling a pool will cause any load balancers using it to failover to the next pool (if any).

properties.name: minimum_origins
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum number of origins that must be healthy for this pool to serve traffic. If the number of healthy origins falls below this number, the pool will be marked unhealthy and we will failover to the next available pool. Default: 1.

properties.name: monitor
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the Monitor to use for health checking origins within this pool.

properties.name: notification_email
properties.description: (Optional) The email address to send health status notifications to. This can be an individual mailbox or a mailing list.
The origins block supports:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A human-identifiable name for the origin.

properties.name: address
properties.description: (Required) The IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the origin, or the publicly addressable hostname. Hostnames entered here should resolve directly to the origin, and not be a hostname proxied by Cloudflare.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: (Optional) The weight (0.01

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to enable (the default) this origin within the Pool. Disabled origins will not receive traffic and are excluded from health checks. The origin will only be disabled for the current pool.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the logpush job to create. Must match the regular expression ^[a-zA-Z0-9\-\.]*$.

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The zone ID where the logpush job should be created.

properties.name: destination_conf
properties.description: (Required) Uniquely identifies a resource (such as an s3 bucket) where data will be pushed. Additional configuration parameters supported by the destination may be included. See Logpush destination documentation.

properties.name: ownership_challenge
properties.description: (Required) Ownership challenge token to prove destination ownership. See Developer documentation.
<hr/>

properties.name: logpull_options
properties.description: (Optional) Configuration string for the Logshare API. It specifies things like requested fields and timestamp formats. See Logpull options documentation.

properties.name: enable
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to enable to job to create or not.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to which the page rule should be added.

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required) The URL pattern to target with the page rule.

properties.name: actions
properties.description: (Required) The actions taken by the page rule, options given below.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) The priority of the page rule among others for this target, the higher the number the higher the priority as per API documentation.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the page rule is active or disabled.
Action blocks support the following:

properties.name: always_online
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: always_use_https
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

properties.name: automatic_https_rewrites
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: browser_cache_ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The Time To Live for the browser cache. 0 means 'Respect Existing Headers'

properties.name: browser_check
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: bypass_cache_on_cookie
properties.description: (Optional) String value of cookie name to conditionally bypass cache the page.

properties.name: cache_by_device_type
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: cache_deception_armor
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: cache_level
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to set the cache level to "bypass", "basic", "simplified", "aggressive", or "cache_everything".

properties.name: cache_on_cookie
properties.description: (Optional) String value of cookie name to conditionally cache the page.

properties.name: disable_apps
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

properties.name: disable_performance
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

properties.name: disable_railgun
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

properties.name: disable_security
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

properties.name: edge_cache_ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The Time To Live for the edge cache.

properties.name: email_obfuscation
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: explicit_cache_control
properties.description: (Optional) Whether origin Cache-Control action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: forwarding_url
properties.description: (Optional) The URL to forward to, and with what status. See below.

properties.name: host_header_override
properties.description: (Optional) Value of the Host header to send.

properties.name: ip_geolocation
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: minify
properties.description: (Optional) The configuration for HTML, CSS and JS minification. See below for full list of options.

properties.name: mirage
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: opportunistic_encryption
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: origin_error_page_pass_thru
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: polish
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "off", "lossless" or "lossy".

properties.name: resolve_override
properties.description: (Optional) Overridden origin server name.

properties.name: respect_strong_etag
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: response_buffering
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: rocket_loader
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to set the rocket loader to "on", "off".

properties.name: security_level
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to set the security level to "off", "essentially_off", "low", "medium", "high", or "under_attack".

properties.name: server_side_exclude
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: smart_errors
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: sort_query_string_for_cache
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: ssl
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to set the SSL mode to "off", "flexible", "full", "strict", or "origin_pull".

properties.name: true_client_ip_header
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".

properties.name: waf
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this action is "on" or "off".
Forwarding URL actions support the following:

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) The URL to which the page rule should forward.

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: (Required) The status code to use for the redirection.
Minify actions support the following:

properties.name: html
properties.description: (Required) Whether HTML should be minified. Valid values are "on" or "off".

properties.name: css
properties.description: (Required) Whether CSS should be minified. Valid values are "on" or "off".

properties.name: js
properties.description: (Required) Whether Javascript should be minified. Valid values are "on" or "off".
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to apply rate limiting to.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: (Required) The threshold that triggers the rate limit mitigations, combine with period. i.e. threshold per period (min: 2, max: 1,000,000).

properties.name: period
properties.description: (Required) The time in seconds to count matching traffic. If the count exceeds threshold within this period the action will be performed (min: 1, max: 86,400).

properties.name: action
properties.description: (Required) The action to be performed when the threshold of matched traffic within the period defined is exceeded.

properties.name: match
properties.description: (Optional) Determines which traffic the rate limit counts towards the threshold. By default matches all traffic in the zone. See definition below.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this ratelimit is currently disabled. Default: false.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A note that you can use to describe the reason for a rate limit. This value is sanitized and all tags are removed.

properties.name: bypass_url_patterns
properties.description: (Optional) URLs matching the patterns specified here will be excluded from rate limiting.

properties.name: correlate
properties.description: (Optional) Determines how rate limiting is applied. By default if not specified, rate limiting applies to the clients IP address.
The match block supports:

properties.name: request
properties.description: (Optional) Matches HTTP requests (from the client to Cloudflare). See definition below.

properties.name: response
properties.description: (Optional) Matches HTTP responses before they are returned to the client from Cloudflare. If this is defined, then the entire counting of traffic occurs at this stage. This field is not required.
The match.request block supports:

properties.name: methods
properties.description: (Optional) HTTP Methods, can be a subset ['POST','PUT'] or all ['_ALL_']. Default: ['_ALL_'].

properties.name: schemes
properties.description: (Optional) HTTP Schemes, can be one ['HTTPS'], both ['HTTP','HTTPS'] or all ['_ALL_']. Default: ['_ALL_'].

properties.name: url_pattern
properties.description: (Optional) The URL pattern to match comprised of the host and path, i.e. example.org/path. Wildcard are expanded to match applicable traffic, query strings are not matched. Use * for all traffic to your zone. Default: '*'.
The match.response block supports:

properties.name: statuses
properties.description: (Optional) HTTP Status codes, can be one [403], many [401,403] or indicate all by not providing this value.

properties.name: origin_traffic
properties.description: (Optional) Only count traffic that has come from your origin servers. If true, cached items that Cloudflare serve will not count towards rate limiting. Default: true.
The action block supports:

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Required) The type of action to perform. Allowable values are 'simulate', 'ban', 'challenge' and 'js_challenge'.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) The time in seconds as an integer to perform the mitigation action. This field is required if the mode is either simulate or ban. Must be the same or greater than the period (min: 1, max: 86400).

properties.name: response
properties.description: (Optional) Custom content-type and body to return, this overrides the custom error for the zone. This field is not required. Omission will result in default HTML error page. Definition below.
The action.response block supports:

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: (Required) The content-type of the body, must be one of: 'text/plain', 'text/xml', 'application/json'.

properties.name: body
properties.description: (Required) The body to return, the content here should conform to the content_type.
The correlate block supports:

properties.name: by
properties.description: (Optional) If set to 'nat', NAT support will be enabled for rate limiting.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to add the record to

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the record

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of the record

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) The (string) value of the record. Either this or data must be specified

properties.name: data
properties.description: (Optional) Map of attributes that constitute the record value. Primarily used for LOC and SRV record types. Either this or value must be specified

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The TTL of the record (automatic: '1')

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) The priority of the record

properties.name: proxied
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the record gets Cloudflare's origin protection; defaults to false.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: - (Required) The port configuration at Cloudflare’s edge. e.g. tcp/22.

properties.name: dns
properties.description: (Required) The name and type of DNS record for the Spectrum application. Fields documented below.

properties.name: origin_direct
properties.description: (Optional) A list of destination addresses to the origin. e.g. tcp://192.0.2.1:22.

properties.name: origin_dns
properties.description: (Optional) A destination DNS addresses to the origin. Fields documented below.

properties.name: origin_port
properties.description: (Optional) If using origin_dns this is a required attribute. Origin port to proxy traffice to e.g. 22.

properties.name: tls
properties.description: (Optional) TLS configuration option for Cloudflare to connect to your origin. Valid values are: off, flexible, full and strict. Defaults to off.

properties.name: ip_firewall
properties.description: (Optional) Enables the IP Firewall for this application. Defaults to true.

properties.name: proxy_protocol
properties.description: (Optional) Enables Proxy Protocol v1 to the origin. Defaults to false.

properties.name: traffic_type
properties.description: (Optional) Set's application type. Valid values are: direct, http, https. Defaults to direct.
dns

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of DNS record associated with the application. Valid values: CNAME.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the DNS record associated with the application.i.e. ssh.example.com.
origin_dns

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Fully qualified domain name of the origin e.g. origin-ssh.example.com.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to apply to.

properties.name: group_id
properties.description: (Required) The WAF Rule Group ID.

properties.name: package_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the WAF Rule Package that contains the group.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Optional) The mode of the group, can be one of ["on", "off"].
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to apply to.

properties.name: package_id
properties.description: (Required) The WAF Package ID.

properties.name: sensitivity
properties.description: (Optional) The sensitivity of the package, can be one of ["high", "medium", "low", "off"].

properties.name: action_mode
properties.description: (Optional) The action mode of the package, can be one of ["block", "challenge", "simulate"].
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to apply to.

properties.name: rule_id
properties.description: (Required) The WAF Rule ID.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: (Required) The mode of the rule, can be one of ["block", "challenge", "default", "disable", "simulate"].
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The zone ID to add the route to.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: (Required) The route pattern

properties.name: script_name
properties.description: Which worker script to run for requests that match the route pattern. If script_name is empty, workers will be skipped for matching requests.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name for the script.

properties.name: content
properties.description: (Required) The script content.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone name which will be added.

properties.name: paused
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether this zone is paused (traffic bypasses Cloudflare). Default: false.

properties.name: jump_start
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether to scan for DNS records on creation. Ignored after zone is created. Default: false.

properties.name: plan
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the commercial plan to apply to the zone, can be updated once the one is created; one of free, pro, business, enterprise.

properties.name: type
properties.description: A full zone implies that DNS is hosted with Cloudflare. A partial zone is typically a partner-hosted zone or a CNAME setup. Valid values: full, partial. Default is full.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to which the access rule should be added.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description about the lockdown entry. Typically used as a reminder or explanation for the lockdown.

properties.name: urls
properties.description: (Required) A list of simple wildcard patterns to match requests against. The order of the urls is unimportant.

properties.name: configurations
properties.description: (Required) A list of IP addresses or IP ranges to match the request against specified in target, value pairs. It's a complex value. See description below. The order of the configuration entries is unimportant.

properties.name: paused
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean of whether this zone lockdown is currently paused. Default: false.
Note: Either zone or zone_id is required and zone will be resolved to zone_id upon creation.
The list item in configurations block supports:

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required) The request property to target. Allowed values: "ip", "ip_range"

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The value to target. Depends on target's type. IP addresses should just be standard IPv4/IPv6 notation i.e. 198.51.100.4 or 2001:db8::/32 and IP ranges in CIDR format i.e. 198.51.0.0/16.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone_id
properties.description: (Required) The DNS zone ID to which apply settings.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: (Optional) Settings overrides that will be applied to the zone. If a setting is not specified the existing setting will be used. For a full list of available settings see below.
The settings block supports settings that may be applied to the zone. These may be on/off values, unitary fields, string values, integers or nested objects.

properties.name: on-off-values
properties.description: » On/Off Values
These can be specified as "on" or "off" string. Similar to boolean values, but here the empty string also means to use the existing value. Attributes available:

properties.name: always_online
properties.description: (default: on)

properties.name: always_use_https
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: automatic_https_rewrites
properties.description: (default value depends on the zone's plan level)

properties.name: brotli
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: browser_check
properties.description: (default: on)

properties.name: development_mode
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: email_obfuscation
properties.description: (default: on)

properties.name: hotlink_protection
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: http2
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: image_resizing
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: ip_geolocation
properties.description: (default: on)

properties.name: ipv6
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: mirage
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: opportunistic_encryption
properties.description: (default value depends on the zone's plan level)

properties.name: opportunistic_onion
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: origin_error_page_pass_thru
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: prefetch_preload
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: privacy_pass
properties.description: (default: on)

properties.name: response_buffering
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: rocket_loader
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: server_side_exclude
properties.description: (default: on)

properties.name: sort_query_string_for_cache
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: tls_client_auth
properties.description: (default: on)

properties.name: true_client_ip_header
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: waf
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: webp
properties.description: (default: off). Note that the value specified will be ignored unless polish is turned on (i.e. is "lossless" or "lossy")

properties.name: websockets
properties.description: (default: off)

properties.name: string-values
properties.description: » String Values

properties.name: cache_level
properties.description: . Allowed values: "aggressive" (default), "basic", "simplified".

properties.name: cname_flattening
properties.description: . Allowed values: "flatten_at_root" (default), "flatten_all", "flatten_none".

properties.name: h2_prioritization
properties.description: . Allowed values: "on", "off" (default), "custom".

properties.name: min_tls_version
properties.description: . Allowed values: "1.0" (default), "1.1", "1.2", "1.3".

properties.name: polish
properties.description: . Allowed values: "off" (default), "lossless", "lossy".

properties.name: pseudo_ipv4
properties.description: . Allowed values: "off" (default), "add_header", "overwrite_header".

properties.name: security_level
properties.description: . Allowed values: "off" (Enterprise only), "essentially_off", "low", "medium" (default), "high", "under_attack".

properties.name: ssl
properties.description: . Allowed values: "off" (default), "flexible", "full", "strict", "origin_pull".

properties.name: tls_1_3
properties.description: . Allowed values: "off" (default), "on", "zrt".

properties.name: integer-values
properties.description: » Integer Values

properties.name: browser_cache_ttl
properties.description: (default: 14400)

properties.name: challenge_ttl
properties.description: (default: 1800)

properties.name: edge_cache_ttl
properties.description: (default: 7200)

properties.name: max_upload
properties.description: (default: 100)

properties.name: nested-objects
properties.description: » Nested Objects

properties.name: minify
mobile_redirect
security_header

properties.description: The minify attribute supports the following fields:

properties.name: css
properties.description: (Required) "on"/"off"

properties.name: html
properties.description: (Required) "on"/"off"

properties.name: js
properties.description: (Required)"on"/"off"
The mobile_redirect attribute supports the following fields:

properties.name: mobile_subdomain
properties.description: (Required) String value

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Required) "on"/"off"

properties.name: strip_uri
properties.description: (Required) true/false
The security_header attribute supports the following fields:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) true/false

properties.name: preload
properties.description: (Optional) true/false

properties.name: max_age
properties.description: (Optional) Integer

properties.name: include_subdomains
properties.description: (Optional) true/false

properties.name: nosniff
properties.description: (Optional) true/false
